description:
When you left click on the address bar once then the whole URL-text gets
highlighted as it suppose to, but the cursor doesn't get placed at the end of
the text (unless you click again)! Because of this, if you click the left arrow
on the keyboard (while the full-URL-text is still highlighted) the cursor
"jumps" (get placed) at the beginning of the URL-text instead at the end of it.
Or, while still in this "full-highlight with no cursor" state you can't select
partial text with the mouse (by holding down the left mouse button on a
particular letter in the URL then moving the mouse pointer to the left or to the
right) either!

This is very annoying, because all other web browsers behave differently. People
who already get used to a certain address bar behavior in previous web browsers
(like Netscape 4.x; IE5.x; IE6.x) in the past 6 years will hate to re-learn a
new address bar behavior.
summary: single-click in URL bar doesn't place caret visibly
